channel.title: Ok really I am confused
channel.description:
Alright well this is one of my very few serious threads, so yeah enjoy.
The tutorial section confuses me now...Alright is it for Servers or Clients? I see a lot of client related tutorials go in there, and nothing ever happens they just stay there, I think the tutorial section should have a child board for client tutorials at least, because even in the client section there is no spot for tutorials...and please don't yell at me for any spelling errors or stuff its 2:05am lol...

item.title: Ok really I am confused
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:21, topic:346229”]Would’ve still happened, just makes our job a little easier.

Plus there’s things like security it probably improved, but I don’t know too much about it to be that certain.[/quote]
Oh well lets get back on topic, so you guys have to wait for a higher staff member to see what happens to the tutorial section?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Would’ve still happened, just makes our job a little easier.

Plus there’s things like security it probably improved, but I don’t know too much about it to be that certain.

item.title: Ok really I am confused
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

So basically if we didn’t break so many rules, it wouldn’t of been needed? or would there still have been the upgrade.

Read full topic

item.title: Ok really I am confused
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Yeah but it enables us to moderate more effectively and quicker so in the long run it helps the community as a whole.
There were a few upgrades you could see anyway, although, I can’t remember them.
Can’t really remember a lot from before the forum changed.

Read full topic

item.title: Ok really I am confused
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

SilentCJ:

There’s a lot of stuff ‘behind the scenes’ you can’t see though, a lot of the upgrades were to do with moderators and staff in general.

So its good for you guys and no one else your saying?

Read full topic

item.title: Ok really I am confused
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:14, topic:346229”][quote author=krackkid link=topic=442613.msg3250962#msg3250962 date=1277754938]
Then shouldn’t the client hacking section be renamed? so people understand it better o.o
[/quote]

I actually suggested that in the staff sections specifically yes, but no action has been taken as of yet.[/quote]
Great minds think alike :rolleyes: but yeah I have been thinking about it for a while, so I was like what the hell and posted.

Read full topic

item.title: Ok really I am confused
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:11, topic:346229”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=442613.msg3250720#msg3250720 date=1277740671]
No I meant, Taharok programmed the filter before.
[/quote]

We don’t want an awful filter, then no tutorials get posted.[/quote]

There was only no tutorials posted because the staff team never bothered to approve any because we were all waiting for SMF 2.0, it took a lot longer than we thought thought due to the error Mitb had though.

If a new filter was programmed again then it would sort some issues, although yes, I’m pretty sure client tutorials belong in client hacking section though.

Read full topic

item.title: Ok really I am confused
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

SilentCJ:

No I meant, Taharok programmed the filter before.

We don’t want an awful filter, then no tutorials get posted.

He’s saying to divide the sections so its more user friendly to understand where to post.

Read full topic

item.title: Ok really I am confused
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

SilentCJ:

No I meant, Taharok programmed the filter before.

Can’t someone look at how the old filter works with the 1.1.* smf, and then compare to see how it would upgrade to smf 2.*? Thats how I learned some (a small bit) of how the client operates.

Read full topic

item.title: Ok really I am confused
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

We need someone who knows how to program in the language SMF#.

But I agree we need the filters back, some of the tutorials aren’t even worth looking at they teach nothing really.

Read full topic

item.title: Ok really I am confused
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

@OFFTOPIC - Wow, you posted this as soon as I went to bed!

@TOPIC - Umm, the problem is not that it goes nowhere. Its that they lost the filtering system with the forum upgrade, as if it was that important. I personally think the upgrade was pointless, as I have no problem with smf. If MITB, or someone from Simple-Machines forums would just design a filtering mod, we wouldn’t have that problem. That, or the mods need to crack down on the dumb stuff.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

Isn’t Client-hacking like Tutorials/Snippets/Tools/etc?

I agree they need to arrange the server section/client section so it’s more user-friendly. :lol:
